thread.title: Colby Cheese Days, Port Fish Day, Pulaski Polka Days
thread.title_full: Colby Cheese Days, Port Fish Day, Pulaski Polka Days

title: Colby Cheese Days, Port Fish Day, Pulaski Polka Days
text:
Colby Cheese Days, Port Fish Day, Pulaski Polka Days By Chelsey Lewis (0) Comments 
Colby: Colby Cheese Days. The birthplace of Colby cheese celebrates that legacy at the 50th annual Colby Cheese Days Friday through next Sunday. Activities include a parade, a 5K/10K run/walk, live music, a tractor pull, carnival rides, lumberjack shows and a cheese curd throwing contest. Admission is free. See abbycolbyareachamber.org . 
Madison: Maxwell Street Days. Browse lots of great bargains along State St. during this outdoor sidewalk sale Friday through next Sunday. Vendors will have everything from clothing and jewelry to books and gifts for sale, plus food from local restaurants. The sale is open from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Friday and Saturday and 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. next Sunday. See maxwellstreetdays.org . 
Port Washington: Port Fish Day. Fill up on fried goodness at the World's Largest One Day Outdoor Fish Fry from 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. Saturday along the lakefront in downtown Port Washington. In addition to the fish fry, there will be a parade, a classic car show, an arts and crafts show, a carnival, live music and fireworks. See portfishday.com . 
Pulaski: Pulaski Polka Days. Get your polka on at one of the largest polka festivals in the Midwest Thursday through next Sunday at the Pulaski Polka Grounds. Bands performing include Chad Przybylski/Polka Rhythms, Polka Country Musicians and the Maroszek Brothers. Admission is $2 Thursday, $15 Friday and Saturday and free on Sunday. See pulaskipolkadays.com . 
Superior: Lake Superior Classic and Custom Boat Show. Boats of every kind — wooden and metal, power and sailing, canoes and kayaks — will be on display on land and in the water at this show from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Saturday at Barker's Island Marina, 250 Marina Drive. Visitors will also have a chance to vote for their favorites in a handful of categories. Admission is free. See lsccbs.info . 
Viroqua: Driftless Music Festival. Experience music in a beautiful setting at this festival from 1 to 10 p.m. Saturday in Eckhart Park. Bands including the Cajun Strangers, Chicago Afrobeat Project and Bumpus will perform. Admission is free. See driftlessmusicfestival.com . 
Waterford: Balloonfest. Nighttime balloon glows will be a highlight — literally — of this festival held Friday through next Sunday on the grounds of Evergreen Elementary School, 817 W. Main St. Balloons are scheduled to launch between 6:30 and 7:45 p.m. Friday and Saturday and 6 and 7:30 a.m. next Sunday. Evening glows are scheduled for 8:15 p.m. Friday and Saturday. Visitors can take tethered rides at 6 p.m. those days. See waterford-wi.org . 
Illinois: Woodstock Folk Festival. Enjoy music from the likes of Ellen Bukstel, Peter Mulvey and Mustard's Retreat at this 30th annual festival from noon to 6 p.m. next Sunday on Woodstock Square in downtown Woodstock. Admission is by donation only; suggested donations are $15 for adults, $25 for a family and $10 for seniors and students. See woodstockfolkmusic.com . 
Michigan: Venetian Festival. It began as a simple candlelit boat parade and has grown into a weeklong celebration of summer that attracts tens of thousands of people. Now in its 85th year, this festival, held Saturday through July 25 throughout Charlevoix, still includes a boat parade along with music, games, sailing regattas, a carnival, fireworks, a parade and a block party. See venetianfestival.com . 
Minnesota: Northwest Water Carnival. What's summer without some sand castles? Go head-to-head with other sandy creations at this festival through next Sunday in Detroit Lakes. For more diversions, there is a shipbuilding competition, a chili cook-off, a classic car show, water fights, kids games and a Bash on the Beach featuring Sawyer Brown on Saturday. See dljaycees.com . 
— Chelsey Lewis 
Please send notice of events three weeks in advance to: All Over the Map, Travel Section, P.O. Box 371, Milwaukee, WI 53201 or to jsfeat@journalsentinel.com, with All Over the Map as the subject. © 2015 , Journal Sentinel Inc. All rights reserved.
